title: David Davies (rugby league, born c. 1915)
text:
David "Dai" M. Davies (c. 1915 – death unknown) was a Welsh professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 8 or 10, or 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Playing career.
International honours.
Dai Davies won nine caps for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> from 1939 to 1948 while at Salford.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Dai Davies played right-, i.e. number 10, in <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>'s 7-4 victory over <a href="Barrow%20A.F.C.">Barrow</a> in the <a href="1938%20Challenge%20Cup">1938</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1937%E2%80%9338%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1937–38 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a>, in front of a crowd of 51,243.
County Cup Final appearances.
About Dai Davies' time, there was <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>'s 5-2 victory over <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1936%20Lancashire%20Cup">1936</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1936%E2%80%9337%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1936–37 season</a> at <a href="Wilderspool%20Stadium">Wilderspool Stadium</a>, <a href="Warrington">Warrington</a> on Saturday 17 October 1936, and played left-, i.e. number 8, in the 7-10 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1938%20Lancashire%20Cup">1938</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1938%E2%80%9339%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1938–39 season</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a> on Saturday 22 October 1938.
